parts.text:
## The Weaver's Song

The loom of life, a tapestry so grand,
Where threads of joy and sorrow intertwine,
A vibrant dance of colours, hand in hand,
A masterpiece in progress, line by line.

The warp, a steady rhythm, strong and true,
The threads of time, unyielding, ever flowing,
Each moment woven, a unique hue,
The past, the present, in its dance bestowing.

The weft, a delicate, shifting, fleeting breeze,
Of dreams and aspirations, hopes and fears,
It weaves a pattern, through the rustling trees,
A tapestry of stories, whispered through the years.

The weaver's hand, a skillful, gentle guide,
With every thread, a choice, a path to take,
Through triumphs, trials, where we choose to stride,
The tapestry unfolds, a story to partake.

The threads of love, a crimson, burning bright,
Embracing hearts, with warmth and tenderness,
The threads of pain, a shadowed, mournful night,
A reminder of fragility, a solemn mess.

The threads of laughter, silver, ringing clear,
Echoing joy, in whispers and in shouts,
The threads of tears, a glistening, salty tear,
A cleansing rain, that washes fear and doubts.

And as the tapestry grows, a masterpiece unfolds,
With every thread, a story, a lesson learned,
Of lives that blossom, and of tales untold,
A testament to beauty, fiercely earned.

The weaver's song, a symphony divine,
A melody of moments, fleeting yet profound,
A testament to life, in every line,
A tapestry of souls, forever intertwined.

Through changing seasons, the loom continues to sway,
The weaver's hand, tireless, weaves the day,
From dawn to dusk, the threads forever play,
The tapestry of life, in its endless display.

So let us cherish, every thread, every hue,
For in the grand design, our story is true,
A symphony of moments, forever new,
A woven masterpiece, forever me and you.
